alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 9:39PM EST until December 22 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston...and at Edwardsport down to Hazleton. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 and a half inches late last week caused minor flooding to develop along portions of the White River and the East Fork White River in southern parts of central Indiana. The crest on the White River is at Edwardsport with points downstream steady to slowly rising. The crest on the East Fork White River is near Seymour with flooding expected to end Tuesday morning. Flooding along the White River is expected to end by Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Govenors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday /7:30 PM CST Monday/ the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Monday /7:30 PM CST Monday/ was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by noon Tuesday.
